title: stop reporting players
body: please stop reporting people because you the person that is reporting some one are a hypocrite and contradict your self. What i mean by that is do not act like you as a player have never been toxic what so ever nor have been afk nor have gotten smashed which is the same as intent feeding or just sucking because whats the difference there really is none due to the fact that both players still died nonstop and if 4 other players can win they will it happens all the time. whats that your top laner died 14 times in lane and you still won the game or whats that your jungler is walking under turret and chasing and you still won the game. So with that 99.9% of the community is toxic or has been toxic or something that can be construed as being toxic saying gg can be toxic so yah there is that why no one wants to lose or likes to lose so saying nothing is better. Also do not act like you have never afkd from a match because pretty much every one has. So with that so what if some one is toxic chances are you'll never play with them again so why does it matter if you report them? So with that give people the benefit of the doubt and do not reprot people becuase in the end YOUR every bit as guilty as the player you just reproted that to me is plain wrong

replies.body: That's like saying no one should ever report crimes to the police because everyone has sped or jaywalked. It's moronic. There's a huge difference between speeding and murder.

Even if there wasn't a difference in severity; hell, even if the differences were reversed, it's still a ridiculous notion.
Even a murderer has the right to report being robbed. I suppose you could call it hypocrisy, but it's fundamental that everybody is equal in the eyes of the law. Even criminals.
https://media.giphy.com/media/glmRyiSI3v5E4/giphy.gif
Intentional feeding isnt punishable due to feeding part. But due to your intention to ruin game. Feeding is ok, losing game for your team is ok.
both results in losing so why does it matter if its one or the other? but ruined the game so why does it matter

> [{quoted}](name=khorney,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Nup8URtw,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-06-08T19:45:27.439+0000)
>
> both results in losing so why does it matter if its one or the other? but ruined the game so why does it matter

Doesnt matter. Losing is just part of the game. Its about BEHAVIOR. If u go to football stadium to play some football with friends and you are goalkeeper and opponent team is really good and keeps scoring, your teammates wont kick u out. Yet if u take ball and start scoring at your own goal, your teammates will never play with you again. In both cases you are losing. Yet only in second one are you being bad person.
You act like the only reason you play league is to win and not to have fun. It's possible to have fun without winning...
Do you like to lose?  That's why there is aram

You can have fun while in a traffic jam. That doesn't mean I like traffic jams.
It just means I acknowledge the risk of being stuck in a traffic jam when I go for a long ride in a car, and when that scenario happens I make the best of it, rather than writing angry posts on how all the other drivers suck and are to blame for the traffic jam on some car forum on the internet.

And if I really **really** couldn't stand the prospect of being stuck in a traffic jam? I'd probably avoid long rides with a car whenever possible. Especially since this particular region is actually designed to have you be stuck in a traffic jam 50% of the time.

In other words: If you don't like losing, I recommend not playing a game that tries to find even matches i.e. aims at a winrate of 50% for every player.

It sounds like you just got a chat restriction and are undergoing behavior denial.

Everyone is responsible for their own actions. Justifying misdeed by saying everyone else does it as well is not a valid excuse, especially when not everyone actually does it. For every screaming brat that 'punishes' their team for saying something they dont want to hear, there are a dozen adults that dont give a shit about what the angry kid on their team thinks or says.

I remember getting a few chat restrictions years ago, before i realized there is no point in trying to argue with useless trash (first rule: dont feed the trolls). I have definitely never AFKed from a game on purpose, intentionally fed, or trolled - aside from picking weird stuff in blinds, and still making a solid effort to win.

I would hazard a guess that the vast majority of the LoL community has an equal or better track record, the toxic trash minority is simply vocal.

you proved my point being afk feedign or toxic its all teh samethign every one has done it regardless if youyr power went out or not are u not screwing your team over? making it 4v5 . so yah its the samething
Having a power outage is hardly something anyone has control over. You *do* (i hope) have control over ragequitting.. If you do not, you are way too young to be playing pvp games.

Dude afk is still afk is it not? You left a match and made it 4v5. Rage quitting sure is different but at the end of the day the match was still 4v5 because you went afk regardless of ragequitting, you had to go for some reason,  or the power went out.

I'm not really a hypocrite. I don't flame and I don't go afk. I have 2900 wins and 2700 losses (normal games). I've played this game for 7 years and I only have 4 leaver marks on my account and that's due to connection problems. I have recieved 0 bans, chat restrictions or warnings. Yes, I am feeding in some matches. However, I do unwillingly so and the only alternative would be to either stay afk in my base or hug the tower on someone elses lane and thus handicap my teammate. Please don't treat feeding and intentionally feeding as the same thing. 
Also, I never report someone for having a bad game. The game is designed around snowballing and unless your enemy screws up or you get heavily assisted by your jungler, chances are you get crushed in lane after dying once. That's just how this game is. 

As to "chances are you'll never play with them again". That's true. however, that doesn't really matter. Others will have to play with the toxic player and that's something I don't want either. If you're normally pretty chill and just have a outburst for whatever reason, chances are my report won't affect you anyway.
Not really, I was supp I gave my ez adc a triple kill right off plus the cs ahead and he gets smashed by then enemy Draven who was down on cs by alot and had 0 kills..... Wtf does that tell you?

Think you're confused about the report system. Getting reported 1 game for something won't ban you but when you accumulate reports over several games that's when it matters. Which is why you should report players to flag down ones that are repeat offenders and do toxic things casually.
How would you know repeat offenders?  Have you personally played with the same person for a bunch different games

You don't report players that are repeat offenders, you report players that exhibit negative behaviour. 
If that player is a repeat offender, you won't be the only person to report them though; they will be (validly) reported over a lot of games.
The system then determines whether or not it should dish out a punishment depending on frequency and severity of the negative behaviour.
Stop posting.
If i'm toxic, int feeding or have been afk  every game people shouldn't report me?????. Sounds like you don't want to be punished for afks or being toxic.
why would you do that every single game i really want to know? its different players my guideline still apply regardless
I don't have to report every single game, because most of the time the players know what's acceptable and that's not.
No they do not dude. I may findsomething offensive that you do not.  I just don't report anyone why you ask is why report them you are just as guilty

If I'm just as guilty I'll be punished just as much as those I report. If I get chat restricted I'll seriously evaluate what got me to that point and change, just as they should. 

What you seem to be missing is I'm not condemning the players I report, saying "this guy must be punished!" I realize people have rough days where things push them over the edge, and my experience playing with them may be the exception rather than the rule. The report system ignores the occasional bad day, so those players are completely uneffected by my report. The only people who run into issues then are those who are found more guilty than that.
you know nothing......... enough time wasted.........

I'm saying that it's not okay either way, dip-ass.
your not black so why does it matter? the other player maybe black.

I rarely afk and even more rarely behave anywhere close to "toxic". I imagine I've been reported  each and every time that I've afk'd. I deserved to be, and knew it when I walked away from the game. That's the choice I made when I decided to be done with the game. Actions have consequences. If the behavior is truly rare, then the consequences will be light. I've never suffered more than a slap on the wrist for whatever poor behavior I've engaged in. Reporting is the means by which the disciplinary system identifies consistently poor behavior. Furthermore, it is a logical fallacy (Tu Quoque , meaning "you too") to assert that a person's guilt makes their opinion of another's guilt irrelevant.
I think I've gone too long without sleep and then tried to read this
